messages.title: A local man campaigning with fresh ideas and listening to the views of the people
messages.content: As a Councillor I have tried to do this by regularly meeting with residents, which has led me to fight for better sport and leisure facilities, increased school places, safer roads, as well as campaigning for the Stubbington bybass.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Scrapping hospital parking charges. Extending GP opening hours.
Increasing Grammar School numbers. Scrapping some university tuition fees.
Improving our bus network. Repairing our roads more effectively.
Removing overzealous red-tape. Reviewing zero-hour contract legislation.
Ensuring sentences mean what they say. Aiding crime prevention and rehabilitation.
Removing tax on earnings under £13,500. Abolishing Inheritance Tax.
Devolving real planning power to councils. Protecting our green and pleasant land.
Increasing our Royal Naval assets. Guaranteeing veterans a 'uniformed' job.

issues.education: Increasing Grammar School numbers. Scrapping some university tuition fees.
issues.environment: Protecting our green and pleasant land.
issues.health: Scrapping hospital parking charges. Extending GP opening hours.
issues.immigration: Introducing private health insurance for tourists and migrants until they have paid National Insurance for 5 years.

housing.content: Devolving real planning power to councils. Protecting our green and pleasant land.

leaflet.personalStatement: I believe the whole point of an MP is to listen to the views of the people they represent, interpret them to the best they can and then work on their behalf.

politicalExperience.achievements: Successfully fought to safeguard disabled children’s services and voted against cuts to libraries, however I don’t do opposition for opposition’s sake so I have voted in favour of budget cuts where the services provided would still be protected.

images.caption: Listening to your views right across our Constituency

leaflet.additionalNotes: Money the other parties won’t save you: £9bn - Reducing Foreign Aid. £8bn - Leaving the EU. £5bn - Cutting renewable energy subsidies. £5bn - Abolishing the Department for Culture, Media and Sport by devolving its portfolio. £2bn - Reforming the Department for Energy and Climate Change. £2bn - Introducing private health insurance for tourists and migrants until they have paid National Insurance for 5 years.
